description: 1 print : color halftone ; sheet 22.3 x 15.2 cm. | Print shows an advertisement for the Paradise Brook Trout Company showing a brook trout caught on a hook, leaping out of the water, also two illustrations of buildings at the edge of streams or holding ponds, and at the bottom corners are four examples of flyfishing flies. Text printed on verso, beneath a masthead showing two whales or dolphins spouting, states "Our water supply, which is cold mountain spring water, is perfect. The source of each of the ten springs is on our own acres, nestling in the hills of the famous Pocono Mountains. As it cannot be used by others before reaching us, the waters cannot become polluted in any manner. Our latest advanced methods known to the fish culturist of to-day, in conjunction with our pure water supply, gives us the desired result - strong, vigorous trout, in the best possible physical condition. Disease among our production is unknown."

medium: 1 print : color halftone ; sheet 22.3 x 15.2 cm.
mediums: 1 print : color halftone ; sheet 22.3 x 15.2 cm.
notes: Caption continues: A good trout stream without any trout is like the play of Hamlet with Hamlet left out.
Forms part of: Marian S. Carson collection at the Library of Congress.
item.repository: Library of Congress Prints and Photographs Division Washington, D.C. 20540 USA http://hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print
